maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific table or all tables in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryTable cmdlet gets information about a specific table or all tables in an Azure data factory. If you do not specify the name of a table, the cmdlet returns properties of all tables in the Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf
TableName : DACuratedWikiData ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Policy : Structure : {} Published : False
TableName : DAWikipediaClickEvents ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Policy : Structure : {} Published : False
TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Policy : Structure : {} Published : False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about all tables in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name DAWikipediaClickEvents
TableName : DAWikipediaClickEvents ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureBlobLocation Policy : Microsoft.DataFactories.Policy Structure : {} Published : False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about the table 'DAWikipediaClickEvents' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
(Get-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name DAWikipediaClickEvents).Location
BlobPath : wikidatagateway/wikisampledatain/ FilenamePrefix : Format : LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceWikipediaClickEvents PartitionBy : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para:
Returns location details for the table 'DAWikipediaClickEvents'. You can also assign the output the Get-AzureDataFactoryTable cmdlet to a variable and then print Location property of the output variable. Example:
$table = Get-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name DAWikipediaClickEvents $table.Location

maml:description.maml:para: Gets all the slices for a table in an Azure data factory that are produced after the specified time.

The Get-AzureDataFactorySlice cmdlet gets all the slices for a table in an Azure data factory that are produced after the StartDateTime and before the EndDateTime. The data slice with status Ready is ready for consumption by dependent slices. Here are the slice statuses and their descriptions.
PendingExecution : Data processing has not started yet. InProgress : Data processing is in-progress. Ready : Data processing has completed and the data slice is ready. Failed : Execution of the run that produces the slice failed Skip : Skip processing of the slice. Retry : Retrying the run that produces the slice Timed Out : Data processing has timed out. PendingValidation : Data slice is waiting for validation against validation policies before being processed. Retry Validation : Retry the validation of the slice Failed Validation : Validation of the slice failed
For each of the slices, you can drill-down deeper, and see more information about the run that is producing the slice by using Get-AzureDataFactoryRun and Get-AzureDataFactoryRunLog, cmdlets.
Slices that are produced after the specified time are returned.
Slices that are produced before the specified time are returned.
Slices that are produced before the specified time are returned.
Slices that are produced after the specified time are returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactorySlice -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -TableName DAWikiAggregatedData -StartDateTime 2014-05-20T10:00:00
ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData Start : 5/21/2014 1:00:00 AM End : 5/21/2014 2:00:00 AM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready
ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData Start : 5/21/2014 2:00:00 AM End : 5/21/2014 3:00:00 AM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready
ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData Start : 5/21/2014 3:00:00 AM End : 5/21/2014 4:00:00 AM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready
ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData Start : 5/21/2014 4:00:00 AM End : 5/21/2014 5:00:00 AM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready
ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData Start : 5/21/2014 5:00:00 AM End : 5/21/2014 6:00:00 AM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready

maml:description.maml:para: The Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet gets information about a specific gateway or all gateways in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet gets information about a specific gateway or all gateways in an Azure data factory. You need to install a gateway on your on-premises computer so to be able add an on-premises SQL Server as a linked service to a data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf
Name : gateway1 Location : West US Description : Version : 1.3.5338.1 Status : Online VersionStatus : UpToDate CreateTime : 8/22/2014 1:40:34 AM RegisterTime : 8/22/2014 1:41:46 AM LastConnectTime : 8/22/2014 1:44:56 AM ExpiryTime :
Name : gateway2 Location : West US Description : Version : 1.3.5338.1 Status : Offline VersionStatus : UpToDate CreateTime : 8/29/2014 1:46:44 AM RegisterTime : 8/29/2014 1:48:36 AM LastConnectTime : 8/29/2014 1:56:56 AM ExpiryTime :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about all gateways in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryGateway -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name gateway1
Name : gateway1 Location : West US Description : Version : 1.3.5338.1 Status : Online VersionStatus : UpToDate CreateTime : 8/22/2014 1:40:34 AM RegisterTime : 8/22/2014 1:41:46 AM LastConnectTime : 8/22/2014 1:44:56 AM ExpiryTime :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about the gateway 'gateway1' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific Azure data factory or all Azure data factories in the specified Azure resource group.

The Get-AzureDataFactory cmdlet gets information about a specific Azure data factory or all Azure data factories in the specified Azure resource group. If the data factory name is not specified, all the Azure data factories in the subscription are returned.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactory -ResourceGroupName ADF
DataFactoryName : WikiADF ResourceGroupName : ADF Location : WestUS Tags : {} Properties : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Utilities.PSDataFactoryConfiguration
DataFactoryName : WikiADF2 ResourceGroupName : ADF Location : westus Tags : {} Properties : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Utilities.PSDataFactoryConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about all data factories in the Azure subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactory -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name WikiADF
DataFactoryName : WikiADF ResourceGroupName : ADF Location : westus Tags : {} Properties : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Utilities.PSDataFactoryConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about the data factory 'WikiADF' in the Azure subscription.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactory WikiADF -ResourceGroupName
DataFactoryName : WikiADF ResourceGroupName : ADF Location : westus Tags : {} Properties : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Utilities.PSDataFactoryConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about the data factory 'WikiADF' in the Azure subscription. This example is same as the previous one except that the "-Name" is not used in the command.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific pipeline or all pipelines in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline cmdlet gets information about a specific pipeline or all pipelines in an Azure data factory. If you specify a pipeline name for the Name parameter, it returns information about that specific pipeline; otherwise, it returns information about all the pipelines.
Name of the Azure data factory.
Name of the Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf
PipelineName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ------------ ----------------- --------------- ---------- DPWikisample ADF WikiADF Microsoft.DataFactories.PipelineProperties DPTwittersample ADF WikiADF Microsoft.DataFactories.PipelineProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about all pipelines in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name DPWikisample | format-list
PipelineName : DPWikisample ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.PipelineProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about the pipeline 'DPWikisample' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
(Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Name DPWikisample).Properties
Activities : {WikiHiveActivity, BlobToSqlCopyActivity} Description : DP Wikipedia Sample Pipelines End : 6/6/2014 8:00:00 AM IsPaused : RuntimeInfo : Microsoft.DataFactories.PipelineRuntimeInfo Start : 6/5/2014 8:00:00 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prints properties of the pipeline 'DPWikisample' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
(Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Name DPWikisample).Properties.Activities
Transformation : Microsoft.DataFactories.HDInsightActivityProperties Description : Inputs : {DAWikipediaClickEvents} LinkedServiceName : HDILinkedService Name : WikiHiveActivity Outputs : {DACuratedWikiData} Policy : Microsoft.DataFactories.ActivityPolicy
Transformation : Microsoft.DataFactories.CopyActivityProperties Description : Inputs : {DACuratedWikiData} LinkedServiceName : HDILinkedService Name : BlobToSqlCopyActivity Outputs : {DAWikiAggregatedData} Policy : Microsoft.DataFactories.ActivityPolicy

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about all the activities in the pipeline 'DPWikisample'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
(Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Name DPWikisample).Properties.RuntimeInfo
DeploymentTime -------------- 6/5/2014 10:36:46 PM

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the runtime information for the pipeline 'DPWikiSample'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
(Get-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF11 -Name DPWikisample).Properties.Activities[0].Inputs | format-list
EndTime : Length : Name : DAWikipediaClickEvents StartTime :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about inputs for the first activity (Copy Activity) in the pipeline 'DPWikisample'.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific linked service or all linked services in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService cmdlet gets information about a specific linked service or all linked services in an Azure data factory. If you specify the name of the linked service as a parameter, the cmdlet returns properties of that linked service; otherwise, it returns properties of all linked services.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF | format-list
LinkedServiceName : HDILinkedService ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.HDInsightBYOCLinkedService
LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceCuratedWikiData ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureStorageLinkedService
LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceHDIStorage ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureStorageLinkedService
LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureSqlLinkedService
LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceWikipediaClickEvents ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureStorageLinkedService

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about all linked services in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name HDILinkedService
LinkedServiceName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ----------------- ----------------- --------------- ---------- HDILinkedService ADF wikiadf-adminnext471-4 Microsoft.DataFactories.HDInsightBYOCAsset

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets information about the linked service 'HDILinkedService' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the URL for HDInsight logs corresponding to the run for a data slice.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryRunLog cmdlet gets the URL for HDInsight logs corresponding to the run for a data slice. A table of an Azure data factory is composed of slices over the time axis. The width of a slice is determined by the schedule - hourly/daily. The run is the unit of processing for a slice. There could be one or more runs for a slice in case of retries or if you rerun your slice in case of failures. A slice is identified by its start time. Therefore, for the Get-AzureDataFactoryRun cmdlet, you need to pass in the start time of the slice from the result of the Get-AzureDataFactorySlice cmdlet. You pass the the run ID from the output of the Get-AzureDataFactoryRun cmdlet to the Get-AzureDataFactoryRunLog.
Run ID that you get from the Get-AzureDataFactoryRun command.
Run ID that you get from the Get-AzureDataFactoryRun command.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryRunLog -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF -Id a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819
AbsolutePath : /a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819 AbsoluteUri : https://<storageaccountname>.blob.core.windows.net/a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819?sv=2013-08-15&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sr=c&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sig=bn5hcjApAQpAbMnblWQNQd9fZvQ8BjkCBSLaB9jjoIY%3D&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;st=2014-05-21T19:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;se=2014- 05-21T21:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sp=rl LocalPath : /a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819 Authority : <storageaccountname>.blob.core.windows.net HostNameType : Dns IsDefaultPort : True IsFile : False IsLoopback : False PathAndQuery : /a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819?sv=2013-08-15&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sr=c&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sig=bn5hcjApAQpAbMnblWQNQd9fZvQ8BjkCBSLaB9jjoIY%3D&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;st=2014-05-21T19:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;se=2014-05-21T21:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sp=rl Segments : {/, a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819} IsUnc : False Host : <storageaccountname>.blob.core.windows.net Port : 443 Query : ?sv=2013-08-15&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sr=c&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sig=bn5hcjApAQpAbMnblWQNQd9fZvQ8BjkCBSLaB9jjoIY%3D&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;st=2014-05-21T19:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;se=2014-05-21T21:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sp=rl Fragment : Scheme : https OriginalString : https://<storageaccountname>.blob.core.windows.net/a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819?sv=2013-08-15&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sr=c&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sig=bn5hcjApAQpAbMnblWQNQd9fZvQ8BjkCBSLaB9jjoIY%3D&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;st=2014-05-21T19:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;se=2014- 05-21T21:09:56Z&amp;amp;amp;amp;amp;sp=rl DnsSafeHost : <storageaccountname>.blob.core.windows.net IsAbsoluteUri : True UserEscaped : False UserInfo :

maml:description.maml:para: Get all the runs for a data slice of a table in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryRun cmdlet gets all the runs for a data slice of a table in an Azure data factory. A table in an Azure data factory is composed of slices over the time axis. The width of a slice is determined by the schedule - hourly/daily. The run is an unit of processing for a slice. There could be one or more runs for a slice in case of retries or if you rerun your slice in case of failures. A slice is identified by its start time. Therefore for the Get-AzureDataFactoryRun cmdlet, you need to pass in the start time of the slice from the results of the Get-AzureDataFactorySlice cmdlet.
For example, to get a run for the following slice, you use 2015-04-02T20:00:00. ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : SPDataFactory0924 TableName : MarketingCampaignEffectivenessBlobTable Start : 5/2/2014 8:00:00 PM End : 5/3/2014 8:00:00 PM RetryCount : 0 Status : Ready LatencyStatus :
Start date time of the slice.
Start date time of the slice.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryRun -DataFactoryName WikiADF -TableName DAWikiAggregatedData -ResourceGroupName ADF -StartDateTime 2014-05-21T16:00:00
Id : a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819 ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF TableName : DAWikiAggregatedData PipelineName : 249ea141-ca00-8597-fad9-a148e5e7bdba ActivityId : fcefe2bd-39b1-2d7a-7b35-bcc2b0432300 ResumptionToken : a7c4913c-9623-49b3-ae1e-3e45e2b68819 ContinuationToken : ProcessingStartTime : 5/21/2014 5:02:41 PM ProcessingEndTime : 5/21/2014 5:04:12 PM PercentComplete : 100 DataSliceStart : 5/21/2014 4:00:00 PM DataSliceEnd : 5/21/2014 5:00:00 PM Status : Succeeded Timestamp : 5/21/2014 5:02:41 PM RetryAttempt : 0 Properties : {[errors, ]} ErrorMessage :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all runs for slices of the table DAWikiAggregatedData in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' starting from 4 PM GMT on 05/21/2014.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about a specific hub or all hubs in an Azure data factory.

The Get-AzureDataFactoryHub cmdlet gets information about a specific hub or all hubs in an Azure data factory. If the hub name is not specified, the cmdlet returns properties of all hubs in the Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Get-AzureDataFactoryHub -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Name HDIHub
HubName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ------- ----------------- --------------- ---------- HDIHub adf brgoldtest

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays information about all hubs in the Azure data factory.

maml:description.maml:para: Links a data store or a compute service to the specified Azure data factory.

Links a data store or a compute service to the data factory. You need to create linked services before creating tables in an Azure data factory. If a linked service with the same name already exists, you will need to confirm whether to overwrite the existing linked service unless you specify the -force flag.
Here is the sequence of operations you perform:
1) Create a data factory. 2) Create linked services. 3) Create tables 4) Create a pipeline
Path including the name of the JSON file that has the description of the linked service.
Name of the Azure resource group.
Path including the name of the JSON file that has the description of the linked service.
Name of the Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name LinkedServiceCuratedWikiData -DataFactoryName wikiadf -File c:\\samples\\WikiSample\\LinkedServiceCuratedWikiData.json | format-list
LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceCuratedWikiData ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureStorageLinkedService

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a linked service 'LinkedServiceCuratedWikiData' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'. This linked service links an Azure blob store specified in the JSON file to the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a pipeline in the specified Azure data factory.

Creates a pipeline in the specified Azure data factory. If a table with the same name already exists in the data factory, you will be prompted to confirm whether to overwrite the existing table unless you use the -force flag.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the table.
Name of the Azure resource group.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the table.
Name of the Azure resource group.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name DPWikisample -DataFactoryName wikiADF -File c:\DPWikisample.json
PipelineName : DPWikisample ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF11 Properties : Microsoft.DataFactories.PipelineProperties

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a pipeline 'DPWikisample' in the Azure data factory 'ADF' based on information in the DPWikisample.json file. This file includes information about activities such as Copy Activity and HDInsight Activity in the pipeline.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a table in the specified Azure data factory.

Creates a table in the specified Azure data factory. If a table with the same name already exists, you will be asked to confirm whether to overwrite the existing table unless you use the -force flag.
Here is the sequence of operations you perform:
1) Create a data factory. 2) Create linked services. 3) Create tables. 4) Create a pipeline.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the table.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the table.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name DAWikipediaClickEvents -DataFactoryName wikiADF -File c:\\samples\\WikiSample\\DA_WikipediaClickEvents.json
TableName : DAWikipediaClickEvents ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureBlobLocation Policy : Microsoft.DataFactories.Policy Structure : {} Published : False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a table 'DA_WikipediaClickEvents' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' based on information in the DAWikipediaClickEvents.json file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$table = New-AzureDataFactoryTable -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name DAWikipediaClickEvents -DataFactoryName wikiADF -File c:\\samples\\WikiSample\\DA_WikipediaClickEvents.json
TableName : DAWikipediaClickEvents ResourceGroupName : ADF DataFactoryName : WikiADF Availability : Microsoft.DataFactories.Availability Location : Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureBlobLocation Policy : Microsoft.DataFactories.Policy Structure : {} Published : False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a table 'DA_WikipediaClickEvents' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' based on information in the DAWikipediaClickEvents.json file and assigns the output to a variable named $table.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$table.Availability
AnchorDateTime : Frequency : Hour Interval : 1 Offset : WaitOnExternal : Microsoft.DataFactories.WaitOnExternal

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns details about the Availability property of the table you created in the previous step.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$table.Location
BlobPath : wikidatagateway/wikisampledatain/ FilenamePrefix : Format : LinkedServiceName : LinkedServiceWikipediaClickEvents PartitionBy : {}

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns details about the Location property of the table you created earlier.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$table.Policy.Validation | format-list
MinimumRows : MinimumSizeMB : 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns validation rules for the table.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a gateway key for the specified Azure data factory gateway.
The New-AzureDataFactoryGatewayKey cmdlet creates a gateway key for the specified Azure data factory gateway. You register the gateway with cloud service using this key.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryGatewayKey -ResourceGroupName ADF -GatewayName gatewaySample -DataFactoryName wikiADF | Format-List
Gateway Key : ADF#40cbb3d9-2736-4794-a8a6-e6b839b4894f@a2d875ce-c9d7-4b8b-ad65-dd3ebbb9a940@8c0d1801-e863-44af-82e6-fb2f0c00f2ae@xz#Y9R0NhAeH3u7wgnrJyiWj4Y/QIhH4fFilIdzZgwsVQA=

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a gateway key for the Azure data factory gateway 'gatewaySample'.

maml:description.maml:para:
Creates an Azure data factory given the resource group name and location. Only 'WestUS' is supported for location at this moment. If the data factory with the same name already exists, you will need to confirm whether to overwrite the existing data factory unless you use the -force flag.
Here is the sequence of operations you perform:
1) Create a data factory. 2) Create linked services. 3) Create tables 4) Create a pipeline.
Name of the data factory to be created.
Location for the Azure data factory. For example: westus or eastus. Only westus is supported at this moment.
Name of the resource group to which the data factory should belong.
Location for the Azure data factory. For example: westus or eastus. Only westus is supported at this moment.
Name of the data factory to be created.
Name of the resource group to which the data factory should belong.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactory -Name WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF -Location WestUS
DataFactoryName : WikiADF ResourceGroupName : ADF Location : WestUS Tags : {} Properties : Microsoft.WindowsAzure.Commands.Utilities.PSDataFactoryConfiguration

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates an Azure data factory 'WikiADF' in the resource group 'ADF' in the 'WestUS' location.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a gateway in the specified Azure data factory.
The New-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet creates a gateway in the specified Azure data factory.
Location of the gateway. For example: westus.
Location of the gateway. For example: westus.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryGateway -ResourceGroupName ADF -Name gatewaySample -DataFactoryName wikiADF -Location WestUs -Description "my gateway"
Name : gatewaySample Location : West US Description : my gateway Version : Status : NeedRegistration VersionStatus : None CreateTime : 8/22/2014 1:40:34 AM RegisterTime : LastConnectTime : ExpiryTime :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a gateway 'gatewaySample' in the Azure data factory 'wikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a hub in the specified Azure data factory.

Creates a hub in the specified Azure data factory. If a hub with the same name already exists, you will be asked to confirm whether to overwrite the existing hub unless you use the -force flag.
Here is the sequence of operations you perform:
1) Create a data factory. 2) Create linked services. 3) Create hubs.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the hub.
Path including the name of the JSON file that contains the description of the hub.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
New-AzureDataFactoryHub -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Name HDIHub -File c:\\samples\\WikiSample\\HubWiki.json
HubName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ------- ----------------- --------------- ---------- HDIHub adf brgoldtest

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a hub 'HDIHub' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' based on information in the HubWiki.json file.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$hub = New-AzureDataFactoryHub -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Name HDIHub -File c:\\samples\\WikiSample\\HubWiki.json
HubName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ------- ----------------- --------------- ---------- HDIHub adf brgoldtest

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a hub 'HDIHub' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' based on information in the HubWiki.json file and assigns it to the output to a variable named $hub.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified pipeline from an Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactoryPipeline cmdlet removes the specified pipeline from an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactoryPipeline DPWikisample -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove pipeline 'DPWikisample' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the pipeline 'DPWikisample' from the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified table from an Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactoryTable cmdlet removes the specified table from an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactoryTable DAWikiAggregatedData -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove table 'DAWikiAggregatedData' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the table 'DAWikiAggregatedData' from the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified linked service from an Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService removes the specified linked service from an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService LinkedServiceTest -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove linked service 'LinkedServiceTest' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the linked service 'LinkedServiceTest' from the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactory cmdlet removes the specified Azure data factory.
Name of the Azure data factory.
Name of the Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactory WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove data factory 'WikiADF' in resource group 'ADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y True

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified gateway from an Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet removes the specified gateway from an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactoryGateway -Name gatewaySample -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove gateway 'gatewaySample' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is Y): Y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the gateway 'gatewaySample' from the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the specified hub from an Azure data factory.
The Remove-AzureDataFactoryHub cmdlet removes the specified hub from an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Remove-AzureDataFactoryHub -Name HDIHub -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to remove hub 'HDIHub' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the hub 'HDIHub' from the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Resumes the specified pipeline that is currently in suspended state in an Azure data factory.
The Resume-AzureDataFactoryPipeline cmdlet resumes the specified pipeline that is currently in suspended state in an Azure data factory.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Resume-AzureDataFactoryPipeline DPWikisample -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to resume pipeline 'DPWikisample' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Resumes the pipeline 'DPWikisample" in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' that was suspended before by using the Suspend-AzureDataFactoryPipeline command.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the active period for the data slices that are processed by the pipeline. If you use Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus, make sure that the slice startdate and end date are in the active period of the pipeline.

Once the pipelines are created, you can specify the duration in which data processing will occur. By specifying the active period for a pipeline, you are defining the time duration in which the data slices will be processed based on the Availability properties that were defined for each ADF table.
The start date-time of the duration in which data processing will occur or the data slices will be processed.
The end date-time of the duration in which data processing will occur or the data slices will be processed.
The end date-time of the duration in which data processing will occur or the data slices will be processed.
The start date-time of the duration in which data processing will occur or the data slices will be processed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Set-AzureDataFactoryPipelineActivePeriod -Name DPWikisample -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -StartDateTime 2014-05-21T16:00:00 -EndDateTime 2014-05-22T16:00:00
Confirm Are you sure you want to set pipeline 'DPWikisample' active period from '05/21/2014 16:00:00' to '05/22/2014 16:00:00'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the active period for the data slices that are processed by the pipeline 'DPWikisample' to 5/21/2014 4 PM GMT to 5/22/2014 4 PM GMT.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the status of slices for a table in an Azure data factory.
Name of the Azure data factory.

Status of the slice. These are the possible values for the status parameter and their descriptions:
Ready - Data processing has completed and the data slice is ready. PendingExecution - Data processing has not started yet. PendingValidation - Data slice is waiting for pending validation on whether it fulfills the against validation policies before being processed. Skip - Skip processing of the slice.

Type of update to the slice. These are the possible values for the UpdateType parameter and their descriptions:
Individual - Sets the status of each slice for the table in the specified time range. UpstreamInPipeline - Sets the status of each slice for the table and all the dependent (upstream) tables which are used as input tables for activities in the pipeline.
Name of the Azure data factory.

Status of the slice. These are the possible values for the status parameter and their descriptions:
Ready - Data processing has completed and the data slice is ready. PendingExecution - Data processing has not started yet. PendingValidation - Data slice is waiting for pending validation on whether it fulfills the against validation policies before being processed. Skip - Skip processing of the slice.

Type of update to the slice. These are the possible values for the UpdateType parameter and their descriptions:
Individual - Sets the status of each slice for the table in the specified time range. UpstreamInPipeline - Sets the status of each slice for the table and all the dependent (upstream) tables which are used as input tables for activities in the pipeline.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Set-AzureDataFactorySliceStatus -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -TableName DAWikiAggregatedData -Status PendingExecution -UpdateType UpstreamInPipeline -StartDateTime 2014-05-21T16:00:00 -EndDateTime 2014-05-21T20:00:00
True

dev:remarks.maml:para:
Sets the status of all slices for the table 'DAWikiAggregatedData' to 'PendingExecution' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.
The UpdateType is set to UpstreamInPipeline, which means that status of each slice for the table and all the dependent (upstream) tables which are used as input tables for activities in the pipeline is set to "PendingExecution". Other possible value for this parameter is "Individual".

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the properties of a linked service in an Azure data factory.
The Set-AzureDataFactoryLinkedSevice sets the properties of an existing linked service in an Azure data factory.
Path including the name of the JSON file that describes a linked service.
Path including the name of the JSON file that describes a linked service.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Set-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData -DataFactoryName WikiADF -File C:\Demos\samples\LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData.json -ResourceGroupName ADF
LinkedServiceName ResourceGroupName DataFactoryName Properties ----------------- ----------------- --------------- ---------- LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData ADF WikiADF Microsoft.DataFactories.AzureSqlAsset

dev:remarks.maml:para: Updated an existing linked service 'LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF' based on information in the LinkedServiceWikiAggregatedData.json file.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the properties for an Azure Data Factory (for example: HCatalog connection string).
The Set-AzureDataFactory sets the properties for an Azure Data Factory (for example: HCatalog connection string).
Sets the description for the gateway.
The Set-AzureDataFactoryGateway cmdlet sets the description for the specified gateway.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Set-AzureDataFactoryGateway -Name gatewaySample -ResourceGroupName ADF -DataFactoryName WikiADF -Description "my gateway sample"
Name : gatewaySample Location : West US Description : my gateway sample Version : 1.3.5338.1 Status : Online VersionStatus : UpToDate CreateTime : 8/22/2014 1:31:09 AM RegisterTime : 8/22/2014 1:31:37 AM LastConnectTime : 8/22/2014 1:41:41 AM ExpiryTime :

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the description for the gateway 'gatewaySample'.

maml:description.maml:para: Suspends the specified pipeline in an Azure data factory.
The Suspend-AzureDataFactoryPipeline cmdlet suspends the specified pipeline in an Azure data factory. You can resume the pipeline later by using the Resume-AzureDataFactoryPipeline cmdlet.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Suspend-AzureDataFactoryPipeline -Name DPWikiSample -DataFactoryName WikiADF -ResourceGroupName ADF
Confirm Are you sure you want to suspend pipeline 'DPWikisample' in data factory 'WikiADF'? [Y] Yes [N] No [S] Suspend [?] Help (default is "Y"): Y True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Suspends the pipeline 'DPWikiSample' in the Azure data factory 'WikiADF'.

maml:description.maml:para: Encrypts sensitive data (e.g. password, SQL Server connection string) and returns an encrypted value.
The New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue cmdlet encrypts sensitive data (e.g. password, SQL Server connection string) and returns an encrypted value.
Value that needs to be encrypted.
Value that needs to be encrypted.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$value = ConvertTo-SecureString "Data Source=servername;Initial Catalog=catelog;user id =user123;password=password123" -AsPlainText -Force New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue -GatewayName wikiGateway -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Value $value -ResourceGroupName ADF
data source=servername;initial catalog=catelog;EncryptedCredential=KAAAAAABAAAQAAAAQUU5MUVBNzY4QkFCQkI3MEUwRTMxOUNFNkM0MjRDOTVDNDk3RTcyRi8XAXyE/H+f3JydTkdg5t2g1eC/VtyF3NAD3idYnhrAphPJmO0pCaG5nH2IY48L3XJi7wabrlrGF+ieiWh1bwdgdxrW+t2jWPnLvT/ENUXtcevpx/ dmTGKagH8TU9HLcoL1CAanb7Vkpga1B/uzRxBnVdsdtfvBzxG2M810tj1WzL8lFzA1mO5GbB0+ge116y0scL1vxjerjl5Muv0r0scG3lhj+IF0sXUMITFvhQwOIqweR052E6JlfJu+mTNFLCCkpw1iV+rhRhKqJF752dBuWjzI1EoyQUE17oK4OevkquuhUbfJmzj9B hGKQ+VkndAZiSw19FEGSC7JzoUe/XWEs/FJYrQCCXIeNS94J9/VzN6KPYJR1pzAYCtnhq+p8Q==

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the encrypted value for connection string you passed for the Value parameter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
$value = ConvertTo-SecureString "Test123" -AsPlainText -Force New-AzureDataFactoryEncryptValue -DataFactoryName wikiadf -Value $value -ResourceGroupName ADF
$Encrypted$String$

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the encrypted value for string you passed for the Value parameter.
